answerText: Grignard reagents[10] The reaction of Grignard reagents with nitriles yields ketones. The simplest nitrile is this moiety, with formula CN minus, which smells of almonds when bound to hydrogen.
heading: Michigan Fall Tournament |2013 | Haverford Round 10 | 18 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question: These reagents exist as an equilibrium of several different organometallic compounds called the Schlenk equilibrium. For 10 points each: [10] Name these organomagnesium halide reagents.
